channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 29th July
item.description:
3 way traffic lights plus temporary footway closure required 28 days please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation and brambles back to boundary approximately 80 metres x3 metres (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 29th July
item.description:
Overgrown trees disguising Belisha beacons. Can I please ask for this to be revisited? (See 22081491) I was using this crossing before I reported the incident, where a car did not stop and nearly collided with me. This car was coming in the direction facing the Belisha beacom which is hidden by the overgrown tree (see photos attached) and I am not convinced this is a coincidence. This report was filed to be "monitored" but given that the tree completely hides one of the lights please can I ask the situation to be looked at again?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 29th July
item.description:
Give and take plus temporary footway closure required 28 days please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation and brambles back to boundary approximately 20 metres x3 metres (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole difficult to avoid on very narrow bridge, 28th July
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing public bin, flytipping & drug paraphernalia, 28th July
item.description:
These are ongoing issues that constately crop up especially the litter, drug paraphernalia and overflowing bin. 1.Public bin is overflowing 2.Pink suitcase fly tipped 3.Boxes of used laughing gas canisters 4.Litter strewn across road/grass verges
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stilchester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Bramble bush overhanging footpath, 28th July
item.description:
About halfway down this footpath behind the nature reserve there's a bramble bush overhanging the path, making it necessary to duck under it. Please could this be cut back? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Banbury and Cheltenham Direct Railway, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Redundant sign post to be removed., 28th July
item.description:
A traffic restriction signpost has been placed outside 10 Market Street for over a year now, and sign has been removed but the post has not. Can you arrange for this post to be removed and the pavement made good.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Market Street, St Paulâ€™s, Cheltenham
